intro: Hippuris maritima, commonly known as sea rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its bright green, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is typically found in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline environments, showing a high tolerance for brackish water. Its roots help stabilize soil and prevent erosion in these habitats. Hippuris maritima plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining the health of coastal ecosystems.
